website_summaries.verdict: A highly praised option that provides insurance against future leaks and punctures.
pros: Comes in a variety of sizes up to one gallon
Stays in liquid form to protect against slow leaks and punctures
cons: The sealing compound is great – if you can get it into the tires
Some buyers say the pump delivery system hard to use

customer_reviews.title: Fix and Prevent Flats
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My son's bike had a flat, and he was a little deflated (hah). 3 minutes later he's riding away with his friends! Later that night, I deflated the other tire and applied sealant to the tube to help future mishap. Tips: There is a tube built into the bottle. His wheels have Schrader valves, I used the cap to remove the valve stem and made the tube snug over the valve body. After applying the sealant, I put a little air in the tire and spun it. Then I applied full pressure and spun it again.
customer_reviews.author: AH_CA

customer_reviews.title: The air now stays in the tires
customer_reviews.text: I had some golf cart tires that kept going flat. I went Berryman and couldn't be happier. I've used the other stuff before, and it was ok, but I think this product seals better. It pumps in pretty easy, and since one pump is an ounce it makes it easy to crank in the right amount. And, don't cheap out when you pump it in. Look up how much stuff to use, and use the full amount. If it says 8oz, then pump in 8oz. My golf cart tires have remained inflated, and that's the bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: Hammerman

customer_reviews.title: It worked about 10 time better than Slime.
customer_reviews.text: Up to this point in my motoring career, going on 50 years now, I had used "Slime" with mixed results. As of the last couple of years I have had zero success with Slime. Decided to try a different brand (Seal R Tire Sealing Compound). This one worked 100 %. 1/3 rd the price of "Slime". Thanks for providing a product at a very good price that actually works as advertised. Even after being in a rut from time to time with unwarranted loyalty to a product I was able to jump out of the rut. Even a blind chicken gets a kernel of corn now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Glen M. Ternes

customer_reviews.title: Jettison the slime...this is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Berryman's for years, but, the retail supplier that I depended on stopped carrying it in favor of the green slime stuff (pitiful substitute). When I found Berryman's on Amazon, I quickly ordered 2 gallons. I use it in my garden tractor tires as well as both hunting vehicles (truck & mule). There is absolutely no vibration in my truck on the highway as a result of the sealant. This is the best product on the market for protection against punctures...period!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Pucker-up
customer_reviews.text: So far this stuff has proven to be the "Cat's Meow". I used this for a total of three tires on two riding mowers. All were quite cracked with age, two ten years old and one twenty years old. It's been a month now and they are still holding pressure. Removed wheels, laid flat, removed stems, pumped in the Seal-r, replaced stem, manipulated each wheel to ensure coating of the sidewalls (some of the cracks were on the sidewalls), filled tires with air then re-manipulated the Seal-r around the sidewalls again, re-installed on tractors. That simple! I'll update the review in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Xzaviar Moses

customer_reviews.title: Won't Rust your Wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Non-corrosive as compared to Slime (which uses water as a solvent and can cause rust to unprotected surfaces). Wish I could buy Tire Seal-R from a local supplier/autoparts store. No luck finding it locally though I had seen it at some point in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Derek J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is a utter waste of money that cannot be used in street vechile tires, something the ad claimed. If you use it in street tires, it will ruin the senors in the wheels a massive and expensive fix. Massive buyers regret
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing pump
customer_reviews.text: The description and product photo have a pump, but mine arrived with just the clear hose and no way to attach it to the jug. Now I have to put it into a container with a small spout to put it in the tire. Update: I poured the product into a Slime bottle and injected it into a leaky lawn tractor tire. The tire has held for over a week, so I'll say the product works.
customer_reviews.author: Sibco96

customer_reviews.title: Always worked well for me
customer_reviews.text: My mower picks up lots of mesquite tree thorns and Berryman works good. It's a bit messy if you have to change a tire but it cleans right up with water. I've used the (green stuff) and it's not nearly as effective as Berryman.
customer_reviews.author: R. A.

customer_reviews.title: No tube included to connect the bottle to the valve stem!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived without a flexible tube to connect the bottle to the valve stem. The flexible tube is shown in the instructions on the bottle but it was not included. This made it almost unusable on my lawn mower and wheel barrow. I improvised by using something I had laying around but it made a big mess. I got more sealant on the outside of the wheels and the ground than I got inside the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I put 2oz in a old cracked tube/tire on a garden hose cart that would lose air in just a few hours. It is still holding air after two weeks...amazing. I added 8 oz in both tires on my Harley EG and have put 2000 miles in last two weeks. The tires were balanced before I added sealant and I felt no change. I plan on using it next tire change too. The hose and pump worked slick and not too much mess as long as you take your time.
customer_reviews.author: madtownrydr

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: rubber chunks in Berryman's seems to be a little bigger. This stuff works better than the green stuff and I've used it where the green stuff failed and it did the trick. Little more difficult to find, but worth the search!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great buy & use it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tire sealing. I used it on several tires / tube / tubeless with wonderful results. Looks like I didn't get a full gallon! Product works 5 stars due to the lack of content I gave 4 stars. I used other brand for years and it worked as long as you used it. Always have the same tire pressure even after weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy, Charlotte, NC

customer_reviews.title: Works great on UTV, golf car, bicycle, and riding mower tires.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third gallon of this tire sealer. Rarely do I have to re-inflate any tires that I have treated with this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: JRDAWN

customer_reviews.title: Saved me buying new tires
customer_reviews.text: Had multiple puncture leaks and previous plugs in my DR Field and Brush mower tires. I was ready to buy new 6 ply tires but gave this stuff a try. Tried slime before and no help. This stuff works. Tires would go flat in 6-8 hours now holding over 24 hrs. Thank you Berryman!!!
customer_reviews.author: DaveM

customer_reviews.title: That you can still find this product.  All others carry yhe green slim
customer_reviews.text: I've used this in the passed works better then the green slim. Little on the expensive side.
customer_reviews.author: LVGacres

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a week now and my ATV tire (which had a steady leak) remains inflated. Easy Install and water cleanup. Very Pleased with Performance so far. ***6 month update: Amazing! I still have not had to put air in tires that I sealed with this compound.
customer_reviews.author: M P

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good stuff! I've used better and I definitely used worse.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works pretty good all in all. It's a little thin but that is nice sometimes when you're trying to seal a bead on a small Tire. I think the one I got was old as the hose keeps kinking.
customer_reviews.author: Mayson Ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Put this in some old lawn mower tires that had been sitting flat for a couple of years. They were even creased on the side walls. Took a few times inflating and rotating but it finally worked. All four tires holding air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more Flats
customer_reviews.text: Had a tire that would go flat on my zero turn between every mowing. Stuff really works no more Flats.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: It works and priced well
customer_reviews.text: Used it to seal Cub Cadet leaking lawn tractor tires. Did as instructed and seemed to work fine. One tire ended up going flat after two weeks. I only filled it back with air and has not leaked since. So other than the first leaking tire, which I’m not sure why that happened, it seems to be working well and holding the tire pressure just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Poolsean

customer_reviews.title: Gallon had been opened.
customer_reviews.text: When unboxing, I noticed that the pump was not included. The screw on cap had been taped and I thought it was just added security for shipping. So I removed the tape and unscrewed the cap. The seal was gone and apparantly the gallon had been previously opened. Then looking at the side that showed the 1 qt, 2 qt and 3 qt marks, the liquid was just above the 3 qt mark. So, it appears that the shipment had been opened, partly used and then returned without the pump.... and then resold again.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: the best stuff made
customer_reviews.text: the best stuff made, " slime " sucks. This works super well on farm implement and mower tires. remove the schrader valve give it a few pumps, then air it back up about 10-15 pounds over normal. This is the trick .. then use/ride/roll it right then for 10-15 mins and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: ww

customer_reviews.title: No Pump!!
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't come with the pump needed to get transfer the stuff from the jug to the tire. I thought this was a mistake with my order, so I returned it, but the replacement didn't have it either. Instead of wasting my time trying to find a pump head that will fit, I'm buying something else. I don't recommend you waste your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Pirvu

customer_reviews.title: Ride improved
customer_reviews.text: On a 14" ATV tire I put in 12 pumps which is about 12 oz and it rides much better and appears to balance the tires as well as provide protection against
customer_reviews.author: Susan O

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Used a full bottle. Hard to get valve stem tool on core to pump stuff in. Once in only lasted 1/3rd of a acre and tire went flat. I noticed when I demounted tire that tube was all slimey.
customer_reviews.author: Joel M. Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 2 riding mowers that had slow tire leaks. A little surprised how well it worked. Nice to not have to add air to tires when time to mow!
customer_reviews.author: T Skill

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stuff! I have a large property with thorns on the outskirts, giving me flat tires on the regular. So far one tire with 3 thorns has not been flat in over a week!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Grieninger

customer_reviews.title: No pump in jug
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bottle. Unfortunately this jug didn’t have the pump in it. Luckily I have an external hand pump so I got it in.
customer_reviews.author: Pinnie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on all 4 tires!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Tried using slime and kept having issues, got this bad boy used on all 4 of my golf cart tires, haven't had issues in over 2 weeks! Before it would take less than a week and all 4 tires would be flat!
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t work
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great on my bike tires when I was young. What happened? It didn’t work so I had to clean it out and use that green goop stuff
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Two 8oz bottles cost less then one 16oz. Good product. Buy the proper kind of slime. The Tubless will eat you tire tubes. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Does not cause metal corrosion unlike Slime products
customer_reviews.text: Does not have to be removed and cleaned to prevent corrosion of the rim every two years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Tire sealant
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff on a lawn mower tire that kept going down. this product really works , I haven't had to pump up the tire since I used it.
customer_reviews.author: topcat64

customer_reviews.title: Effective Sealing
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to remedy a very slow leak at the plug repair of a puncture. Addition of 1/2 of the 8 oz bottle seems to have taken care of leakage.
customer_reviews.author: P Lam

customer_reviews.title: Great sealant
customer_reviews.text: Use this on my tubeless mountain bike tires. It works great and doesn’t dry out like latex sealant. Works well on miscellaneous tires around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Tubless balancing road hazard sealer
customer_reviews.text: for 2/3rds the price ,,works as good as ride on ,, I am using this in lawnmower to Harley Fatboy Tires.. No complaints. But do have a question for comment has anyone used this in a tubeless spoked Wheel ? .
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Not for MTB
customer_reviews.text: I tried this sealant out for my tubeless mountain bike tires. I tried it as is as well as diluted with propylene glycol. It barely sealed the bead, and it did not seal a 0.5mm puncture in the center of the tread. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Molly A. Petzl

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have aluminum rims on 2) Toyota SUVs that wouldn’t seal to the tires, slowly leaked. I added this sealant, no leaks since! Been 3 months. Tip: use maybe 1/2 of what is suggested. SUV with low profile tires has some vibration for the first 10 miles if it hasn’t been driven.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I used this tire sealing compound twice once on my Polaris Ranger and on a John Deer Mower and it worked great
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is the stuff you want to use on ATV's / Quads. I've used it on my sand tires that have been shaved down "Comp Cut". The tires leaked before adding this sealant and have held up for 18 months with no re-treatments. I'm now ordering more bottles to re-treat my tires and my other ATV tires I have. This stuff is great and will not corrode the aluminum rims like Slime does. If you have a shop change your tire for you, they will love this stuff. It is not nearly as messy as the green stuff when changing tires.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: 4 wheeler
customer_reviews.text: Worked 100% in our 4 wheelers. Been in for over a month and we have not has to put air!!!! Best thing ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny F.

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my old wheelbarrow tires
customer_reviews.text: Used to stop leaks from my wheelbarrow tires. Still working 3 months later
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sealent Ive ever used
customer_reviews.text: The best But getting in the tire was not easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works better than all the others period
customer_reviews.text: Product works great used others never worked at all this worked on every tire and still not a laek
customer_reviews.author: Debra Gara

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my tractor tires
customer_reviews.text: Was very effective for my tractor tires. Tires were splitting from cuts, but this sealed them up.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C Bennett

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Used on Honda ATV, fixed slow leak. Couldn’t give a higher rating because I need to see how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: russell randant

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work exactly like they said
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Put in four old tired lawn mower tires. Week later still pumped up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST WAYS TO PREVENT BIKE TIRE FLATS
customer_reviews.text: YO YO THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST BIKE TIRE SEALANTS. ON A ELECTRIC BIKE YOU NEED THE BEST. A VERY GOOD WAY TO PROTECT BIKE TIRES AND TUBES GOD BLESS YOU ALL
customer_reviews.author: Willie Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: sealed my mower tire worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great it sealed my mower tire that had cracks in side wall .... had to add air a couple times then it sealed it
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I put this in the front tires on my Kubota zero turn because I had to air them up every time I wanted to use it. It sealed both tires really well. I've used green slime before and had a problem with it not sealing a tire 100%. I think that the Berryman's is a lot better than slime. (IMHO)
customer_reviews.author: GPJ

customer_reviews.title: NO PUMP
customer_reviews.text: Although my husband received the product no pump was with this item. Kinda made it hard to use with out pump.
customer_reviews.author: MJ's Oven

customer_reviews.title: BEST PUNCTURE PROOF PRODUCT I'VE FOUND
customer_reviews.text: BEST PUNCTURE PROOF PRODUCT I'VE FOUND. RUN OVER MESQUITE THORNS ALL THE TIME . HAVEN'T HAD A FLAT SINCE I PUT THIS IN MY TIRES.

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to pump up lawnmower tires again to use mower.
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of lawn mower tires always flat from week to week, put this stuff in as per directions and haven't had a tire go flat yet on 2 mowers. Really nice to hop on mower and go without spending 15 mins. pumping up tires.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Had 3 flat tires on a riding mower. Used this product, and 2 months later all is well! There are staying inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Andy63

customer_reviews.title: works great on a backhoe tire and mowers tires
customer_reviews.text: used it , works great on a backhoe tire and mowers tires...i had no luck with slime.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: IT works!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and it works. It's a little pricey .
customer_reviews.author: John Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Great for a leaky tractor tire!
customer_reviews.text: I put the recommended amount in a front tractor tire that was going flat within 24 hours of filling. I'm sold on this stuff. The tire (on a 4wd Kubota L2900) stays inflated even under the stress of grading and heavy loads. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: geebobaz

customer_reviews.title: Good shtuff
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems to work better than the other manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: john shoup

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use by following the simple instructions. Need to be near or have air compressor close by.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Williams

customer_reviews.title: tire balance
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised but when I go to highway speed the tires are out of balance and cause severe vibration
customer_reviews.author: clifford thorstenson

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire Sealant
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tire sealer for more than 20 yrs. To be honest, I don't use it very often because once it's in the tires, I don't need it again for a long time. This has been the best tire sealer for me. I'm glad I found it again on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: john mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Will buy more.  Very great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Works better than expected. Plugged larger holes in my tractor tires than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: AllenCarCare C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Failed to fix a small puncture in a tube. Never solidified, even after several days. Not sure if I got a bad batch but I would steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kapta Eulator

customer_reviews.title: Seal up UTV tires.
customer_reviews.text: It is still working to seal up my beadlock rim wheels when nothing else would.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff seems to work well, better than Green Slime in my opinion. Property is full of the Honey Locust & Osage Orange thorns. Had to use on a brand new 2 day old tire.
customer_reviews.author: Sigar

customer_reviews.title: Sealed bead on ATV tire
customer_reviews.text: Used to seal leaking beat on ATV tire, it worked well but I needed to remove the wheel and put the wheel on it's side, used 1/3 s of a gallon, but it worked!

customer_reviews.title: Just Works
customer_reviews.text: I use on my tractor tires and fix when nothing else worked I mean nothing.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have ever used !
customer_reviews.text: Best tire sealant ever used. My only complaint is that I should have known about this a long time ago. Thanks

customer_reviews.text: works great, I used it in my zero turn mower. I have lots of thorns and so far (5 months) no flats.....

customer_reviews.text: Tires still loosing air, has slowed but still leak, no obvious intrusions though. Used for atv.

customer_reviews.text: This is a mandatory product in Central Texas with mesquites and prickly pears. Most of these brands are equally effective but this is water based and cleans up quickly and easily

customer_reviews.text: Bike tires have stayed up strong but ATV tires still lose air after putting in more than required

customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great and seems way better than slime. Used this on my tractor tires and my kids bikes. No issues yet.

customer_reviews.text: Works better than any other tire sealer i have tried

customer_reviews.text: ATV tires were always losing air, put this product in and they are holding air just fine.

customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Unfortunately this bottle i received came without a pump.
customer_reviews.author: Smitcoda

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: put it in my jeep tires, and so far so good. I have had a lot of problems with cactus and mesquite thorns puncturing the sidewalls. it already sealed one small leak
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: this stuff is much better. I used slime in the past with disappointing ...
customer_reviews.text: Compared to slime, this stuff is much better. I used slime in the past with disappointing results. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J-P

customer_reviews.title: Better than Slime!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is fantastic, seals puntures almost instantly, sidewall leaks, even existing punctures. I have not lost any air scince using this. Highly recommend it. The only problem is its hard to find locally, I have to order it thru amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Although this was supposed to be the best, the tire on our Ranger still leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believed it actually worked on an 18.4x34 tractor tire! I felt I had nothing to lose by trying! It saved me downtime and money! Would diffidently buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with Berryman Tire Sealant
customer_reviews.text: I had a slow leak in my ATV tire which I could not locate. I've heard horror stories about Slime due to the fact it leaves a mess inside of the tire so I decided to try Berryman Sealant. With the included pump I injected 12 ounces in the tire, filled the tire to 10 lbs psi and immediately took it for a ride. The tire never went flat and so far has held for nearly a month so I'm pretty confident it will continue to hold air. Make sure you get a tool to remove the valve core otherwise you won't be able to inject the sealant.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff I've found so far
customer_reviews.text: Used it to seal up a sand paddle and pesky leaking beadlock Method wheel. Two trips and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: PDX_RZR

customer_reviews.title: No flat
customer_reviews.text: Had a leak in one tire on my yard tractor where it had been previously plugged. I poured the sealant into the tire and it sealed up the leak!!

customer_reviews.title: Great farm product
customer_reviews.text: Great farm product! I've used this product on wagons, shredders, wheel barrows, dollies and riding mowers. Most are still holding air.
customer_reviews.author: Garry L. Land

customer_reviews.title: I don't like a walk home!
customer_reviews.text: We put this in our 4 bikes. No flats so far... Much easier than fixing flat after flat. Will update if I have an issue.

customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great on all of my tractors and the price point is reasonable compared to the other brands!

customer_reviews.text: it leaks from the top when you pump it .. really messy.. could do better on the container...but it stop leaks..

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you want a tire sealer that will not harm your alloy rims this is it.

customer_reviews.text: Only used for flat mower tires so far, but seems to be working well. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zoart

product_meta.title: Berryman 1332 R Tire Sealing Compound, 1. Fluid_Ounces
product_meta.description: Size:32-Ounce Squeeze BottleInstantly seals leaks and protects pneumatic tires and tubes from small nails, thorns, and other sharp objects. Stays liquid permanently and uses innovative fiber technology to plug leaks and prevent loss of air pressure. Advanced corrosion inhibitors protect all types of wheels, including steel, chrome, and alloy. Seals porosity leaks in magnesium and aluminum composition wheels. Available in a variety sizes for any job. Nonflammable and biodegradable formula. Great for tractor tire ballasting.
feature_bullets: Instantly seals pneumatic tires and tubes
Protects against nails, screws, Thorns, and other sharp objects
Safe on all types of wheels including Steel, chrome, and alloys
Stays Liquid permanently and won't rust or corrode
